title: Yields Spiking, Equity Markets Shaky, Recovery Firm - Market Strategy Weekly - February 26, 2021
text: In the fixed income world, the yield on the 10-year Treasury bond briefly broke through 1.60% Thursday. This is still low by historical standards but represents a sharp and rapid. We look at weakness in the bond market (remember, bond prices fall as yields rise) and the resulting equity market volatility as both a test and a signal.

title: Is the 40-Year Bond Bull Market Over?
text: The bull market in bond prices has steady, durable, and trustworthy. Over the past 40 years, if investors could count on anything, it was rising bonds and falling bond yields (interest rates).

title: Manufacturing And Housing - Turn Even Hotter
text: Manufacturing and housing sectors turned white hot this month, with both construction spending and ISM manufacturing data at levels not seen in years. The overall ISM manufacturing reading rose from 58.7 to 60.8, tying the highest reading since the Great Recession, and indeed since 2004.

title: Stock Market Outlook: Mixed After Uninspiring Trading Day
text: The S&P 500 Index sold off by -0.81% in Tuesday's trading session. This is particularly disappointing considering Monday's positive bounce.

title: How to Stay on the Right Side of the Market With This Special Tool
text: Tuesday was a choppy day for the market, which had sporadic price swings plus a large amount of volatility.Â  These days are tough to trade as they can make it hard to see the daily trend direction.

title: The Stock Market Is Like A Fun Bus Ride, But With A Few Scary Moments
text: The stock market swerved out of its lane last week on fears of inflation. Inflation will not be as sudden or severe as commonly feared.

title: Market bull who predicted herd immunity by Independence Day: 'Maybe we weren't optimistic enough'
text: Federated Hermes Chief Equity Market Strategist Phil Orlando expects the U.S. economy to normalize faster than consensus.

title: Stocks are trading on reopening optimism but risks remain, Jim Cramer says
text: "They're betting we'll soon be able to rip our masks off and go back to normal, and that's the crux of this market right now," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Jim Cramer: The stock market is riding on reopening optimism
text: "For the moment, the people who think our long national nightmares coming to an end they are the ones who are winning," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Fed Discusses 10-Year Rates, Market Rescinds Some Gains
text: Fed Governor Lael Brainard became the first Fed officer to directly acknowledge higher 10-year rates appearing on economists' radar screens.

title: The Markets Continue To Consolidate (Technically Speaking For 3/2)
text: Excess bullishness might be signaling a short-term market top. The US economy has proven to be more resilient than initially thought at the beginning of the virus crisis.

title: If earnings don't exceed expectations, Rising rates could spark a 15% correction, says dean of valua
text: Aswath Damodaran, NYU finance professor who's also known as Dean of Valuation, discusses market valuations. With CNBC's Melissa Lee and the Fast Money traders, Guy Adami, Tim Seymour, Dan Nathan and Bonawyn Eison.

title: Market Recap: Tuesday, March 2: Stocks close at session lows
text: Stocks traded lower on Tuesday as the major indexes pulled back after rallying a day earlier. Each of the S&P 500, Dow and Nasdaq erased earlier gains to trade lower intraday.

title: Stock futures flat in overnight trading after Tuesday's losses
text: On Tuesday, the major averages gave back some their sharp gains from Monday.

title: The Dow Fell 140 Points Because a China Spooked Stock Investors
text: China's top banking regulator pointed to the high valuations in equities in developed markets. The remarks trumped lower rates, which usually lifts stocks.

title: Stock Market Today: Stocks Regress After Monday's Romp
text: Monday's euphoric stock-buying binge was put in check, with the major indices giving back some gains on a slow-news Tuesday.

title: API reports a weekly climb of more than 7 million barrels in U.S. crude supplies, sources say
text: The American Petroleum Institute reported late Tuesday that U.S. crude supplies rose by nearly 7.4 million barrels for the week ended Feb. 26, according to sources. The data also reportedly showed gasoline stockpiles fell by 9.9 million barrels, while distillate inventories also declined by about 9.1 million barrels.

title: What's Next for Stocks? Check Out the Bond Market
text: The recent spike in bond yields drove many investors to the sidelines last week, as higher yields drive down the value of future cash flows.

title: US stock close down on tech weakness, rising bond yields
text: 4:05pm: US equities tumble on tech losesÂ  US stocks closed down as the market gave back some of the strong gains from the previous session with tech stocks leading the way.Â  On the day, the Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 143 points, or 0.46%, to 31,391.

title: The Fed: Fed's Daly says asset prices are elevated, but that should not drive interest-rate decisions
text: Asset prices are elevated more than they have been historically, but is not something that should play a role in interest-rate policy, said San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly on Tuesday.

title: The US Economy Is Set Up for Explosive Growth
text: Oxford Economics expects the economy to experience the strongest growth since 1984

title: Goldman Sachs analyst on why there's a structural bull market
text: Goldman Sachs analyst Jeff Currie says there is a structural bull market driven by demand, not supply. He says the way governments interact with the economy in relation to progress on the $1.9 trillion coronavirus relief plan, the European Union's green initiatives and the acceleration of the Chinese restocking cycle, is driving this structural bull market.

title: Stocks end lower as tech shares lead pullback
text: Stocks ended moderately lower Tuesday, giving back some of the gains scored the previous session as a rise in global bond yields relented. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 144 points, or 0.5%, to end near 31,391, according to preliminary figures, while the S&P 500 lost arund 32 points, or 0.8%, finishing near 3,870.

title: Tech stocks lead losses as US indices pull back from rally
text: US stocks were lower on Tuesday with tech stocks leading losses in the Nasdaq and S&P 500 after a strong rally on Monday led investors to profit-taking.Â  US and European markets are racing ahead of their real economies, potentially creating bubbles that could pop, China's banking regulator has warned. Â Guo Shuqing, chair of the China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission, said US and European markets are racing ahead of their real economies, potentially creating bubbles that could pop.

title: Major Averages Begin March With Weekly Chart Warnings
text: A reason for concern is the size of margin debt, which reached a record high at the end of January. If the market starts to decline significantly, there will be margin call selling.

title: The Tell: Why the stock market's big rotation can continue even if bond yields stop rising
text: Rising bond yields get credit for fueling a rotation away from the U.S. stock market's pandemic winners toward shares of companies more sensitive to the economic cycle. In reality, there's a lot more to it, says one market economist.

text: The expected risk premium for the Global Market Index (GMI) ticked higher last month, although it remains well below the trailing realized performance for the benchmark.

title: The Three Rules play âRed Light Green Light'
text: By Kevin Nicholson, CFA With another round of fiscal stimulus likely, interest rates are moving higher and the equity markets have stalled. The obvious question becomes: what is RiverFront doing from a tactical perspective?

title: Stocks: 3 potential rotation trades to watch for growth
text: Yahoo Finance's Zack Guzman and Aikiko Fujita spokw with Kevin Mahn, Hennion & Walsh CIO to discuss sectors and rotations to watch in the stock market.

title: Inflation Is The Least Of Our Worries
text: The incoming trend was marked by slowing population growth, slow consumption growth, high savings relative to low interest rates, low inflation and a glut of capital. This has all accelerated in the pandemic.

title: The Fed Would Love A 2% 10-Year Treasury
text: The reason why the Fed has not really signaled any concern about the spike in Treasury yields to 1.6% is that the Fed funds rate is anchored at 0-0.25% and any sell-off in the Treasury market expands net interest margins in the financial sector. The Fed wants a higher 10-year Treasury yield but not too high so that it does not become a problem for the economy. The Fed would not allow a Treasury yield spike that would cause the stock market to sell off like it did last March.

title: Market Extra: Record $414 billion of new Treasury debt issuance poses supply test for shellshocked bond buyers
text: Last week's bond-market turbulence is bringing new questions whether investors are capable of absorbing the deluge of Treasurys set for sale this month.

title: The Fed: Fed's Brainard expects âburst' of inflation this year that won't last
text: The U.S. economy could see a "burst" of short-lived inflation this year rather than any durable shift in price level, said Fed Governor Lael Brainard on Tuesday.

title: The Case For A Rapid Economic Rebound In 2021
text: Major stock indexes have set 32 record highs in 2021 so far. The market often looks six months ahead, so it sees a robust first half. Retail sales were up 5.3% MoM in January, after economists expected only 1.2% growth. Consumers are flush with cash, ready to spend when the coast is clear. The personal savings rate was 13.7% in December, almost double the 7.6% rate a year ago.

title: The Technical Indicator: Charting a bullish March start: S&P 500, Nasdaq maintain major support
text: Broadly speaking, the major U.S. benchmarks are acting well technically despite persistently uneven price action in spots, writes Michael Ashbaugh.

title: Are the valuations of high-flying growth stocks justified?
text: 'Halftime Report' trader Josh Brown comments on Zoom stock and the company's earnings report, and why the stock is down for the day. Traders Jim Lebenthal and Stephanie Link discuss high-flying growth stocks

title: CRB Commodities Index Testing Important Trend Line Resistance
text: The broad rally in commodities prices has been very strong, taking turns heating up various commodities along the way. That said, the broad commodities Index, Thomson Reuters Jefferies CRB index, is now trading up at 10-year price resistance.

title: DigitalOcean: Underperforming In A Competitive Landscape
text: The public cloud market has an incredible supply glut. DigitalOcean is lucky to have breached a $1 billion valuation but profitability going forward is highly questionable.

title: Stocks: The vast majority of a portfolio, 80% or more, should always be long-term focused: Schwab VP
text: Yahoo Finance's Myles Udland, Julie Hyman, and Brian Sozzi spoke with Randy Frederick, vice president of trading and derivatives at Charles Schwab about market volatility, retail trading, and the outlook for markets.

title: Wall Street shares lagging at lunch as rising bond yields continue to worry investors
text: US benchmarks were in the red at lunch as rising bond yields continue to put traders off buying into equities despite rising optimism over economic recovery The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 53 points at 31,482. The S&P 500 lost around 16 points at 4,885.

title: Rates Spark: Careful Down There
text: The recovery after last week's rates rise continues, despite a steady drumbeat of encouraging economic releases. The ECB has yet to intervene to lower rates but there seems to have been no dissent on that point yet.
